formattedAddress: 6 Bond St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 6 Bond St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: High-end sushi & Japanese dishes in a chic, trendy atmosphere with a well-heeled crowd.

originalText.text:
Restaurant is spread over a few floors, needing to take an elevator upstairs if your table is there.
The food was actually very good. Good sized portions and fresh.  We had a few rolls, the bass and steak. Everything was excellent except the one thing that prevents a 5 star rating for food is that so many of the dishes were drenched in sauce.  This made the dish exceptionally salty. The sea bass for example was a wonderful piece of fish but there was way too much sauce and it turned out to be very salty.
The table upstairs were a bit too cozy for us. They really try to squeeze as many patrons in as possible. So expect to listen to other people's conversations .... And expect to have others listen to yours.
Service was very good, no complaints there.
On the fence whether I'd come back again.  Having said that our party enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.
I would also like to add that the service they recommend on the bill is a % of the total bill.including tax, when it should be based on the sale before tax, so the suggested % for the tip is actually inflated. That wasn't cool.

originalText.text:
BONDST in New York is a culinary haven that seamlessly marries sophistication with culinary excellence. From the sleek, contemporary design to the vibrant ambiance, the restaurant exudes a refined yet inviting atmosphere. The menu at BONDST is a gastronomic journey through contemporary Japanese cuisine, expertly crafted to tantalize the senses.

What distinguishes BONDST is its commitment to using top-tier ingredients, evident in every dish's meticulous preparation. From the freshest sashimi to innovative sushi creations, each plate is a visual and culinary masterpiece. The restaurant's versatility shines, offering both traditional and inventive dishes that cater to a range of tastes.

The attentive and knowledgeable staff at BONDST elevates the dining experience, providing impeccable service and insights into the menu. Whether you're savoring the exquisite sushi bar or enjoying the elegant dining area, BONDST stands out as a destination for those seeking a luxurious and contemporary take on Japanese cuisine. In the bustling culinary landscape of New York, BONDST remains a culinary gem, inviting patrons to indulge in an unforgettable fusion of artistry and flavor.

originalText.text:
Was there this past weekend, February 3rd and have been thinking of how to write this review since the walk home after. What an amazing experience!  If you want amazing high-end sushi and Japanese food DO NOT MISS BONDST!
This was my first time to BONDST; and it turned into an experience I won’t soon forget.
We walked in and the check-in area was filled with people. Between patrons at the bar for service and those waiting to be seated this place was lively! We got there a few minutes post reservation time and the staff were understanding and got us seated within minutes.
We sat at two seats at the sushi counter nearest to the expo station. The server was helpful with suggestions and guiding us through how to choose a good assortment of dishes to get the full experience.
Cocktails (a special old fashioned and others) were excellently crafted.
The food started and from the first bite we were hooked! The Big Eye Tuna Tarts were perfect! We shared a number of other special appetizers and some sushi. All were served perfectly.
Throughout the night our sushi chef delighted us with his attention and willingness to engage and educate us on the dishes we ordered and others we saw going out. With how busy the place was, we couldn’t help but comment how nice that made the experience.
To cap off what was already an amazing meal, we ended up in a great discussion with none other than Executive Chef Marc Spitzer. We ended up having a nice chat about cooking techniques (soups vide in particular) and other local restaurants that have opened recently. So, yes, I have taken his advice and am waiting for my copy of “Under Pressure” and am excited to learn!
Thank you to everyone at BONST for an amazing night. I can’t wait to go back!

originalText.text:
Great date night spot! Lively, well-dressed crowd, and incredible food.
The process to be seated was a bit hectic and inefficient, seeing half the place empty at 6:30 but trying to create a buzz by packing the bar and entrance with patrons waiting to be seated was not necessary.
Overall, service was on point and friendly, and the drinks were next-level sublime.

originalText.text: I love this place, second time celebrating my birthday there, very loved by celebrities like Taylor Swift. Food is impeccably delicious, ambiance so so, very packed, music was weird and noisy. Service so so, these waiters are stone faced and overwhelmed. Don’t expect them song Happy Birthday either, and expect to pay very steep prices which I guess is expected. Omg all deserts are amazing literally bread pudding, Donnie’s, chocolate cake, panacotta omg
